From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

(Redirected from 200 – Halla Ho)
Indian Hindi-language Vigilante film


200 Hallo HoPromotional posterDirected by
Alok Batra

Written bySarthak DasguptaGaurav SharmaStory by
Abhijeet Das
Soumyajit Roy
Based onAkku YadavProduced by

Running time115 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
200 Halla Ho is a 2021 Indian Hindi-language crime thriller film directed by Sarthak Dasgupta and Alok Batra (in his directorial debut) with production by Yoodlee films. The film is based on the real life incident in which 200 women lynched Akku Yadav, a gangster, robber, serial rapist, and killer in an open court in Nagpur in 2004.[1] It was digitally released on 20 August 2021 on ZEE5.[2][3]


Cast[edit]
Amol Palekar as Justice Vitthal Daangle
Barun Sobti as Umesh Joshi
Ishtiyak Khan as Prof. Avsare
Sahil Khattar as Bali Choudhary
Upendra Limaye as Suresh Patil
Rinku Rajguru as Asha Surve
Flora Saini as Poornima
Indraneil Sengupta as IPS, Sameer Deshpande
Pradhuman Singh as Anwar Sheikh
Saloni Batra as Purva
Apurva Choudhari as Jyoti
Sushama Deshpande as Tarabai Kamble
Vinay Hake as the Reporter
Punit Tiwari as Santosh
Sahana Vasudevan as Neha
Reception[edit]
Arushi Jain of The Indian Express gave the film a mixed review and stated, "Though a torpid screenplay fails the subject of the movie, veteran actor Amol Palekar stays committed to the character of a retired Dalit judge. He brings some profundity to a film that lacks depth."[4] Archika Khurana of The Times of India gave the film 3 out of 5 stars and stated, "If you like non-fiction films based on true stories, this drama definitely deserves a watch in order to comprehend the grief and suffering that those women must have endured."[5] R.M. Vijayakar of India West gave the film a mixed review and stated, "This film may not be a must-watch in the way it is made, but it is certainly not a waste of resources and audience time like Yoodlee’s social thriller past excesses."[6] Mumbai Live gave the film a mixed review and stated, "The movie leaves a lasting impact on your mind and one wonders that no matter how much we talk about equality, there are certain sects that are still struggling to get the respect they deserve."[7] Shantanu Ray Chaudhuri of The Free Press Journal gave the film 3 out of 5 stars and stated, "If only it did not wear its activism, its social agenda, on its sleeves, it would have been more than the polemic tract it often feels like."[8]
Saibal Chatterjee of NDTV gave the film 3.5 out of 5 stars and stated, "Drawing strength from a slew of quietly efficient performances, the director parlays the material into an impactful tale of crime and punishment that transcends genre limitations."[9] News 18 praised its "decent" production values, tone, pacing, "powerful" performances and "dramatic" direction.[10]

References[edit]


^ "Zee5 Global's '200- Halla Ho' tells: Dalit lives matter too!". The American Bazaar. 23 August 2021. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho Release Date: Here's When You Can Stream Rinku Rajguru Starrer Film". Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho, Cartel, Comedy Premium League: What to watch on August 20". The Indian Express. 20 August 2021. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho movie review: A gut-wrenching thriller marred by monologues". The Indian Express. 21 August 2021. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho Review: A well-told story of rebellion against caste discrimination, women oppression". The Times of India. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ Vijayakar, R. M. "'200 – Halla Ho' Review: Fair Blend of Social Issues With Crime". India West. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho review: A story that needs to be told". Mumbai Live. 25 August 2021. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho review: Featuring Amol Palekar, Rinku Rajguru, others, this is a well-meaning film, but fails to create an impact". Free Press Journal. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200: Halla Ho Review - Amol Palekar Headlines Important Film That Takes Caste Question Head-On". NDTV.com. Retrieved 31 August 2021.

^ "200 Halla Ho Movie Review: Barun Sobti and Rinku Rajguru's Film Packed With Powerful Performances". News18. 20 August 2021. Retrieved 31 August 2021.
